page.title: 02Local Employment
page.content: The majority of the working{population who live in the Lexhams today find {employment}in the{farming industry. Most people work on the large farms in the area and do not have to travel far from their homes for work. Even though the work is now largely{mechanised}it is still very hard and the working day is very long. During certain times of the year especially when harvesting of the various crops is underway it is not uncommon for work to start at dawn and end at dusk. Although some cattle and sheep are found in the fields,the vast majority of the land is used for cereal and root crops.The grain from the cereal crops is usually stored in large barns near or on the farms themselves while some of the root crops such as sugar beet are taken to processing plants several miles away.
